parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To think upon, consider attentively. Middle voice from analogia; to estimate, i.e. contemplate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From hupo and meno; to stay under, i.e. Remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. Bear, have fortitude, persevere.
(including the other inflections); from toi and houtos; truly this, i.e. Of this sort (to denote character or individuality).
Contradiction, contention, rebellion. From a derivative of antilego; dispute, disobedience.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To work, be weary, be sick. Apparently a primary verb; properly, to toil, i.e. to tire.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To loose, release, unloose (as a bow-string), relax, enfeeble; pass: To be faint, grow weary. From ek and luo; to relax.
